result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Nicholas J Emons was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Nicholas J Emons was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Emons to 5 and one half years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 and 1 half years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program but not before June 15, 2017, but is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp).

superMiscConds.notes: --Statutory Costs, fees, assessments, surcharges including DNA Surcharge

--Absolute sobriety
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid DL and Agent approval
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--No possession of illegal drugs
--No possession of any dangerous weapon (including brass knuckles)
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Random Urinalyses
--Victim Impact Panel Attendance 
--Provide DNA Sample if one has not already been provided

Arresting Agency: Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt: with criminal case settlement, elements and JI's

Cases 15CF9 & 16CF28 called together at 9:31 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Nicholas J Emons in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

16CF28: Service of the complaint admitted; reading waived
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Emons waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses uncharged referral with a of DOV:11-10-14 Charge Theft (Gas Drive Off) and bars it from further prosecution
ADA Hall submits victim impact statement; Court amends criminal case settlement by Its own hand to correct count #s

The Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on probation for 2 years, consecutive to Count #1, in case 15CF9, but concurrent to Count #4 in Case 15CF9, with conditions:
(SEE CONDITIONS BELOW)
Days Credit for time served given: 0 days

15CF9: 
Court amends criminal case settlement by Its own hand after discussion with counsel, to reflect pleas to correct charges of #1 & #4 not to #2 & #3
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts #1 & #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 & #3

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Emons to 5 and one half years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 and 1 half years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program but not before June 15, 2017, but is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp). 
The Court gives 53 days credit for time already served.

On Count #4, the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Emons on probation for 2 years, consecutive to Count #1, and concurrent to 16CF28, with conditions: 

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision and Probation INLCUDING CASE 16CF28:
--Absolute sobriety
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid DL and Agent approval
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--No possession of illegal drugs
--No possession of any dangerous weapon (including brass knuckles)
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Random Urinalyses
--Victim Impact Panel Attendance (Count #1 Only-15CF9)
--Statutory Costs, fees, assessments, surcharges including DNA Surcharge
--Provide DNA Sample if one has not already been provided
--$1500 fine + costs (Count #1-15CF9)
--To pay restitution of $42.67 payable to Bajwa Gas Station, Watertown (15JE164)
--To pay 10% restitution processing fess (15JE164)

Conditions separate of Extended Supervision on Count #1:
36 month driver license revocation
36 month IID installation
6 demerit points
AODA Assessment & follow-through
Victim Impact Panel Attendance

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

Defendant Nicholas J Emons appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.   Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Case called at 9:44am [mo]
[Scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today]
Defendant Nicholas J Emons in court.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews the Court Record.
Upon questioning of the Court, Mr Emons indicates that he is willing to represent himself, but thinks he may be eligible for PD representation since his financial circumstances have changed

Mr. Emons requests a further adjournment to allow application for PD representation
--no objection from ADA Hall, notes that this hearing has been adjourned multiple times

The Court further adjourns this Preliminary Hearing to allow Mr. Emons to seek counsel

The Courts amends Mr. Emons bond to include the condition that he go to the Jefferson Public Defender's office today and follow through with their directions

Further, the Court notes that shall Mr. Emons be denied PD appointment that he should apply for Court Appointed Counsel.
recess: 9:56am

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing: 9/8/15 at 9:00am
NOH for Def. & Jailer for 8/17/15 Preliminary Hrg.//Sent to Def. at Jefferson Co. Jail//No Longer in Custody

ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas J Emons
Current: 138 Marcella St, Oconomowoc, WI 53066 United States  (Effective: 07-22-2015)
Prior: 210 Summit Ave, Watertown, WI 53094
NOH for Def. for 7/20/15 Preliminary Hrg.//Def. in custody

Case called at 8:43am [mo]
Defendant Nicholas J Emons in court, in custody.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance.
The Court inquires of Mr Emons of the status of his Public Defender appointment. Mr. Emons indicates that he was previously appointed Public Defender counsel, further he indicates that he currently does not qualify due to savings account. 

Mr. Emons requests a $10, 000 signature bond, to be released from jail; further he indicates that he will obtain private counsel, that has been arranged through a family member.  
ADA Hall indicates that it was unknown to the State that this would be a bond modification hearing and is prepared to proceed with Preliminary Hearing; further ADA Hall feels bond is appropriate as set.
The Court finds that there is good cause to extend time limits for preliminary hearing so that Mr. Emons can obtain counsel.
The Court adjourns the preliminary hearing
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling; the witness indicates that he is available on set date
The Court continues the cash bail as previously set.




NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing: 8/17/15 at 9:00am
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 2:15pm [mo]
Defendant Nicholas J Emons in appears via video conferencing from the Jefferson County jail, in custody.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
The Court reviews court record.
The Court finds that the warrant has been satisfied and executed.
Mr. Emons explains that he did not receive the violation letter from WCS; further he explains that he was unable to make payments due to financial hardship.
The Court directs Mr. Emons to apply for PD representation.
The Court directs the Clerk to distribute the WCS letter regarding violation to Mr. Emons at the jail; the Court reads the letter to Mr. Emons at this time; Mr. Emons verifies receipt of the documents.

The Court finds that Mr. Emons is making a knowingly, voluntary and intelligent decision to represent himself at this hearing. The Court also finds that Mr. Emons is competent to represent himself. 
Mr. Emons requests to be placed back on SCRAM as he now has employment to pay for fees.
ADA Hall inquires of the whereabouts of the SCRAM bracelet at this time
--Mr. Emons indicates that it is at his residence, that he was able to 'slide it off'

ADA Hall indicates that a Preliminary Hearing was scheduled and removed from the calendar due to the SCRAM violation and subsequent warrant
ADA Hall requests cash bond
 
The Court orders a $1000 cash bond, with the same conditions as previously ordered, with the exception of the removal of SCRAM monitoring and adding no operation of motor vehicle if not already a condition.

recess:2:40pm

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing--July 20, 2015 at 8:30am (needs to be within 10 days due to cash bond amount)

NOH for def sent to LKA

Defendant Nicholas J Emons in court with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. (SPD will apoint counsel.)  Defendant Nicholas J Emons in custody.   Public Service Special Prosecutor Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon agreement of the parties, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Address and DOB information verified. Updated contact phone number provided. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and penalties are recited.
Constitutional rights reviewed. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $10,000.00  Signature Bond, with conditions: 
-  Absolute sobriety.
-  No possession or consumption of alcohol. 
-  Take all prescription medications only as prescribed. 
-  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
-  No operation of a motor vehicle.
-  Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

Case continued for PTC on  1/21/15 at 3:40pm.   Court directs that a routing slip with scheduling information be sent to Br. 3 within 6 days of the PTC.
Recess 1:30pm
